member.name: P:Gum.DataTypes.Behaviors.ElementBehaviorReference.ProjectName
member.summary: Currently unused - this will eventually be used to reference behaviors from different Gum projects.

member.name: M:Gum.DataTypes.DimensionUnitTypeExtensions.GetIsPixelBased(Gum.DataTypes.DimensionUnitType)
member.summary: Returns whether one unit represents one pixel.
member.param: The unit type.
member.returns: Whether one unit represents one pixel.

member.name: P:Gum.DataTypes.ElementReference.Link
member.summary: The location of the file relative to the project if it differs from the Name. By default this will be empty, so the Name will be used to load/save the element. However, if this is not null, then this value is used instead to load the referenced element.

member.name: P:Gum.DataTypes.ElementSave.AllStates
member.summary: Returns all states in the element including categorized states. For uncategorized states, see the States property.

member.name: P:Gum.DataTypes.GumLoadResult.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Error message about why the load may have failed. This does not include errors about missing files - for missing files see the MissingFiles list.
member.remarks: Errors include situations like a malformed XML file - errors which tools like Gum cannot recover from. Missing files, while resulting in an incomplete load, do not put the project in an unusable state, so we do not consider them errors.

member.name: T:Gum.DataTypes.GumProjectSave
member.summary: Represents the data stored in a .gumx file. GumProjectSave instances can be XML Serialized to a .gumx file.

member.name: P:Gum.DataTypes.GumProjectSave.ParentProjectRoot
member.summary: The folder of the root of the parent project if this Gum project is part of a larger project (like a game project or android app). This is a relative path like "../../"

member.name: M:Gum.DataTypes.Variables.StateSave.GetValue(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to get the value for the argument variableName, or null if not found.
member.param: The qualified variable name
member.returns: The value found, or null

member.name: T:Gum.DataTypes.Variables.VariableSaveValues
member.summary: Struct representation of VariableSave which can be used in situations where heap allocation should not occur

member.name: P:Gum.DataTypes.Variables.VariableSave.SourceObject
member.summary: The name of the object that this variable references. For example if the variable is "MyButton.Text", then the SourceObject is "MyButton"

member.name: P:Gum.DataTypes.Variables.VariableSave.ExposedAsName
member.summary: If a Component contains an instance then the variable of that instance is only editable inside that component. The user must explicitly expose that variable. If the variable is exposed then this variable is set.

member.name: P:Gum.DataTypes.Variables.VariableSave.SetsValue
member.summary: Determines whether a null value should be set, or whether the variable is an ignored value. If this value is true, then null values will be set on the underlying data.

member.name: M:Gum.DataTypes.Variables.StateSaveExtensionMethods.Initialize(Gum.DataTypes.Variables.StateSave)
member.summary: Fixes enumeration values and sorts all variables alphabetically
member.param: The state to initialize.

member.name: M:Gum.DataTypes.Variables.StateSaveExtensionMethods.GetValueRecursive(Gum.DataTypes.Variables.StateSave,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value of the variable name from this state. If not found, will follow inheritance to find the value from the base.
member.param: The state in the current element.
The variable name
member.returns: The value found recursively, where the most-derived value has priority.

member.name: M:Gum.DataTypes.Variables.StateSaveExtensionMethods.GetVariableRecursive(Gum.DataTypes.Variables.StateSave,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the first instance of an existing VariableSave recursively.
member.param: The possible state that contains the variable. If it doesn't, then the code will recursively go to base types.

member.name: M:Gum.DataTypes.Variables.StateSaveExtensionMethods.AssignVariableSave(Gum.DataTypes.Variables.StateSave,System.String,System.Object,Gum.DataTypes.InstanceSave,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Assigns a value to a variable. If the variable doesn't exist then the variable is instantiated, then the value is assigned.
member.param: The StateSave that contains the variable. The variable will be added to this StateSave if it doesn't exist.
The name of the variable to look for.
The value to assign to the variable.
The instance that owns this variable. This may be null.
The type of the variable. This is only needed if the value is null.

member.name: T:Gum.DataTypes.RecursiveVariableFinder
member.summary: Class that can find variables and values recursively. There's so many different ways that this happens that this consolidates all logic in one place

member.name: M:Gum.DataTypes.VariableSaveExtensionMethods.FixEnumerations(Gum.DataTypes.Variables.VariableSave)
member.summary: Converts integer values to their corresponding enumeration values. This should be called after variable saves are loaded from XML.
member.param: The VariableSave to fix.
member.returns: Whether any changes were made.

member.name: M:Gum.Managers.ObjectFinder.GetScreen(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the ScreenSave with matching name in the current glue project. Case is ignored when making name comparisons

member.summary: Returns the ElementSave (Screen, Component, or Standard Element) for the argument instance

member.returns: The matching ElementSave, or null if none is found

member.summary: Returns the ElementSave (Screen, Component, or Standard Element) for the argument elementName
member.param: The name of the ElementSave to search for
member.returns: The matching ElementSave, or null if none is found

member.name: M:Gum.Managers.ObjectFinder.GetElementsReferencing(Gum.DataTypes.ElementSave,System.Collections.Generic.List{Gum.DataTypes.ElementSave},System.Collections.Generic.List{Gum.DataTypes.InstanceSave})
member.summary: Returns a list of Elements that include InstanceSaves that use the argument elementSave as their BaseType, or that use an ElementSave deriving from elementSave as their BaseType.
member.param: The ElementSave to search for.
member.returns: A List containing all Elements

member.name: T:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement
member.summary: The base object for all Gum runtime objects. It contains functionality for setting variables, states, and perofrming layout. The GraphicalUiElement can wrap an underlying rendering object.

member.name: F:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.mWhatThisContains
member.summary: A flat list of all GraphicalUiElements contained by this element. For example, if this GraphicalUiElement is a Screen, this list is all GraphicalUielements for every instance contained regardless of hierarchy.

member.name: P:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.EffectiveManagers
member.summary: Returns this instance's SystemManagers, or climbs up the parent/child relationship until a non-null SystemsManager is found. Otherwise, returns null.

member.name: P:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.CanvasWidth
member.summary: The X "world units" that the entire gum rendering system uses. This is essentially the "top level" container's width. For a game which renders at 1:1, this will match the game's resolution.

member.name: P:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.CanvasHeight
member.summary: The Y "world units" that the entire gum rendering system uses. This is essentially the "top level" container's height. For a game which renders at 1:1, this will match the game's resolution.

member.name: P:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.RenderingLibrary#IPositionedSizedObject#X
member.summary: The X position of this object as an IPositionedSizedObject. This does not consider origins so it will use the default origin, which is top-left for most types.

member.name: P:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.RenderingLibrary#IPositionedSizedObject#Y
member.summary: The Y position of this object as an IPositionedSizedObject. This does not consider origins so it will use the default origin, which is top-left for most types.

member.name: M:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.GetAbsoluteWidth
member.summary: Returns the absolute width of the GraphicalUiElement in pixels (as opposed to using its WidthUnits)
member.returns: The absolute width in pixels.

member.name: M:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.GetAbsoluteHeight
member.summary: Returns the absolute height of the GraphicalUiElement in pixels (as opposed to using its HeightUnits)
member.returns: The absolute height in pixels.

member.name: P:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.ElementGueContainingThis
member.summary: The ScreenSave or Component which contains this instance.

member.name: P:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.ContainedElements
member.summary: Returns an enumerable for all GraphicalUiElements that this contains.
member.remarks: Since this is an interface using ContainedElements in a foreach allocates memory and this can actually be significant in a game that updates its UI frequently.

member.name: P:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.Children
member.summary: Returns the direct hierarchical children of this. Note that this does not return all objects contained in the element.

member.name: P:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.AbsoluteX
member.summary: Returns the absolute X of the origin of the GraphicalUiElement. Note that this considers the XOrigin, and will apply rotation

member.name: P:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.AbsoluteY
member.summary: Returns the absolute Y of the origin of the GraphicalUiElement. Note that this considers the YOrigin, and will apply rotation

member.name: P:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.TextureTop
member.summary: The pixel coorinate of the top of the displayed region.

member.name: P:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.TextureLeft
member.summary: The pixel coorinate of the left of the displayed region.

member.name: P:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.TextureWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the displayed region.

member.name: P:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.TextureHeight
member.summary: The pixel height of the displayed region.

member.name: M:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.SetInitialState
member.summary: Sets the default state.
member.remarks: This function is virtual so that derived classes can override it and provide a quicker method for setting default states

member.name: M:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.AddToManagers
member.summary: Adds this as a renderable to the SystemManagers if not already added. If already added this does not perform any operations - it can be safely called multiple times.

member.name: M:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.AddToManagers(RenderingLibrary.SystemManagers,RenderingLibrary.Graphics.Layer)
member.summary: Adds this as a renderable to the SystemManagers on the argument layer if not already added to SystemManagers. If already added this does not perform any operations - it can be safely called multiple times, but calling it multiple times will not move this to a different layer.

member.name: M:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.GetGraphicalUiElementByName(System.String)
member.summary: Searches for and returns a GraphicalUiElement in this instance by name. Returns null if not found.
member.param: The case-sensitive name to search for.
member.returns: The found GraphicalUiElement, or null if no match is found.

member.name: M:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.GetGraphicalUiElementByName(System.String[])
member.summary: Performs a recursive search for graphical UI elements, where eacn name in the parameters is the name of a GraphicalUiElement one level deeper than the last.
member.param: The names to search for, allowing retrieval multiple levels deep.
member.returns: The found element, or null if no match is found.

member.name: M:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.SetProperty(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets a variable on this object (such as "X") to the argument value (such as 100.0f);
member.param: The name of the variable on this object.
The value, casted to the correct type.

member.name: M:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.AnimateSelf
member.summary: Performs AnimationChain (.achx) animation on this and all children recurisvely. This is typically called on the top-level object (usually Screen) when Gum is running in a game.

member.name: E:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.DragOver
member.summary: Obsolete - this does not work. Use RollOn, RollOf, or RollOver for events raised when over an object.

member.name: E:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.LosePush
member.summary: Event which is raised whenever this loses a push. A push occurs when the cursor is over this window and the left moue button is pushed. A push is lost if the left mouse button is released or if the user moves the cursor so that it is no longer over this while the mouse button is pressed.
member.remarks: LosePush is often used to change the state of a button back to its regular state.

member.name: M:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.TryHandleCursorActivity(FlatRedBall.Gui.Cursor,Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.HandledActions)
member.summary: Tries to handle cursor activity. If this returns true, then either this element or one of its children handled the activity.
member.param: Reference to the cursor object
member.returns: Whether this or one of its children handled the cursor activity, blocking other windows from receiving cursor input this frame.
member.remarks:
This method will always allow children to handle the activity first, as children draw in front of their parents. Only components can have UI elements. Standard elements such as Sprites or Containers cannot themselves handle the activity, but they do give their children the opportunity to handle activity. This is because components (such as buttons) may be part of a container for stacking or other organization.
Ultimately this hierarchical logic exists because only the top-most parent is added to the GuiManager, and it is responsible for giving its children the opportunity to perform cursor-related input.

member.name: M:Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement.Destroy
member.summary: Completely removes the GraphicalUiElement from rendering managers, UI

member.name: T:Gum.Wireframe.TimeManager
member.summary: A singleton intended to simplify timing. Activity on TimeManager should get called once per frame so that an entire frame can operate on the same CurrentTime.

member.name: T:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChain
member.summary: Represents a collection of AnimationFrames which can be used to perform texture flipping animation on IAnimationChainAnimatables such as Sprites.

member.name: P:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChain.FrameTime
member.summary: Sets the frame time to every frame in the animation to the value. For example, assigning a FrameTime of .2 will make every frame in the animation last .2 seconds.

member.name: P:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChain.LastFrame
member.summary: Gets the last AnimationFrame of the AnimationChain or null if there are no AnimationFrames.

member.name: P:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChain.Name
member.summary: The name of the AnimationChain.

member.name: P:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChain.TotalLength
member.summary: The total duration of the animation in seconds. This is obtained by adding the FrameTime of all contained frames.

member.name: M:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChain.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an empty AnimationChain.

member.name: M:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChain.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new AnimationChain with the argument capacity.
member.param: Sets the initial capacity. Used to reduce memory allocation.

member.name: M:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChain.FindByName(System.String)
member.summary: Searches for and returns the AnimationFrame with its Name matching the nameToSearchFor argument, or null if none are found.
member.param: The name of the AnimationFrame to search for.
member.returns: The AnimationFrame with matching name, or null if none exists.

member.name: M:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChain.FrameToFrame(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the shortest absolute number of frames between the two argument frame numbers. This method moves forward and backward and considers looping.
member.param: The index of the first frame.
The index of the second frame.
member.returns: The positive or negative number of frames between the two arguments.

member.name: T:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChainList
member.summary: A list of AnimationChains.
member.remarks: This class is often used by IAnimationChainAnimatables to store a list of AnimationChains. Since the AnimationChainList provides a string indexer, it is common to get a reference to an AnimationChain by its name and set it as the IAnimationChainAnimatable's current AnimationChain.

member.name: P:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChainList.FileRelativeTextures
member.summary: Gets and sets whether the AnimationChainList will save the Texture2Ds that its AnimationFrames reference with names relative to the .achx. Otherwise, this property is not used during runtime.

member.name: P:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChainList.TimeMeasurementUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the TimeMeasurementUnit. This defaults to TimeMeasurementUnit.Millisecond and should not be changed. It is included for compatability with older versions of FlatRedBall.

member.name: P:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChainList.Name
member.summary: Gets and sets the intance's name.

member.name: P:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChainList.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the AnimationChain by name. Returns null if no AnimationChain is found.
member.param: The name of the AnimationChain to return
member.returns: Reference to the AnimationChain with the specified name.

member.name: M:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChainList.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiates a new AnimationChainList.

member.name: M:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationChainList.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Instantiates a new AnimationChainList.
member.param: Sets the initial capacity to reduce memory allocation when subsequently calling Add.

member.name: T:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationFrame
member.summary: Stores information about one frame in a texture-flipping animation.
member.remarks: Includes information about which Texture2D to show, whether the Texture2D should be flipped, the length of time to show the Texture2D for, texture coordinates (for sprite sheets), and relative positioning.

member.name: F:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationFrame.Empty
member.summary: Empty AnimationFrame.

member.name: F:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationFrame.Texture
member.summary: The texture that the AnimationFrame will show.

member.name: F:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationFrame.FlipHorizontal
member.summary: Whether the texture should be flipped horizontally.

member.name: F:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationFrame.FlipVertical
member.summary: Whether the texture should be flipped on the vertidally.

member.name: F:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationFrame.TextureName
member.summary: Used in XML Serialization of AnimationChains - this should not explicitly be set by the user.

member.name: F:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationFrame.FrameLength
member.summary: The amount of time in seconds the AnimationFrame should be shown for.

member.name: F:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationFrame.LeftCoordinate
member.summary: The left coordinate in texture coordinates of the AnimationFrame. Default is 0. This value is in texture coordinates, not pixels. A value of 1 represents the right-side of the texture.

member.name: F:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationFrame.RightCoordinate
member.summary: The right coordinate in texture coordinates of the AnimationFrame. Default is 1. This value is in texture coordinates, not pixels. A value of 1 represents the right-side of the texture.

member.name: F:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationFrame.TopCoordinate
F:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationFrame.BottomCoordinate
F:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationFrame.RelativeX
member.summary: The relative X position of the object that is using this AnimationFrame. This is only applied if the IAnimationChainAnimatable's UseAnimationRelativePosition is set to true.

member.name: F:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationFrame.RelativeY
member.summary: The relative Y position of the object that is using this AnimationFrame. This is only applied if the IAnimationChainAnimatable's UseAnimationRelativePosition is set to true.

member.name: M:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationFrame.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new AnimationFrame.

member.name: M:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationFrame.#ctor(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a new AnimationFrame.
member.param: The Texture2D to use for this AnimationFrame.
The amount of time in seconds that this AnimationFrame will display for when it is used in an AnimationChain.

member.name: M:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationFrame.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new AnimationFrame with identical properties. The new AnimationFrame will not belong to the AnimationChain that this AnimationFrameBelongs to unless manually added.
member.returns: The new AnimationFrame instance.

member.name: M:Gum.Graphics.Animation.AnimationFrame.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this.
member.returns: String representation of this.

member.name: F:Gum.Content.AnimationChain.AnimationChainListSave.FileRelativeTextures
member.summary: Whether files (usually image files) referenced by this object (and .achx) are relative to the .achx itself. If false, then file references will be stored as absolute. If true, then file reference,s will be stored relative to the .achx itself. This value should be true so that a .achx can be moved to a different file system or computer and still have valid references.

member.name: M:Gum.Content.AnimationChain.AnimationChainListSave.ToAnimationChainList(System.String)
member.summary: Create a "save" object from a regular animation chain list

member.name: F:Gum.Content.AnimationChain.AnimationChainSave.ParentFile
member.summary: This is used if the AnimationChain actually comes from a file like a .gif.

member.summary: Whether the texture should be flipped horizontally.

member.name: F:Gum.Content.AnimationChain.AnimationFrameSave.FlipVertical
member.summary: Whether the texture should be flipped on the vertidally.

member.name: F:Gum.Content.AnimationChain.AnimationFrameSave.TextureName
member.summary: Used in XML Serialization of AnimationChains - this should not explicitly be set by the user.

member.name: F:Gum.Content.AnimationChain.AnimationFrameSave.FrameLength
member.summary: The amount of time in seconds the AnimationFrame should be shown for.

member.summary: The left coordinate in texture coordinates of the AnimationFrame. Default is 0. This may be in UV coordinates or pixel coordinates.

member.summary: The right coordinate in texture coordinates of the AnimationFrame. Default is 1. This may be in UV coordinates or pixel coordinates.

member.summary: The top coordinate in texture coordinates of the AnimationFrame. Default is 0. This may be in UV coordinates or pixel coordinates.

member.summary: The bottom coordinate in texture coordinates of the AnimationFrame. Default is 1. This may be in UV coordinates or pixel coordinates.

member.summary: Loads a Gum project and fully initializes it for runtime use.

member.returns: The fully-initialized GumProjectSave

member.name: P:RenderingLibrary.Camera.Zoom
member.summary: The zoom value for everything on this camera. Default value of 1. A value of 2 will make everything appear twice as large.

member.name: T:RenderingLibrary.Content.ContentLoader
member.summary: Provides a simple implementation of IContentLoader for applications using the LoaderManager and not specifying their own custom ContentLoader. This content loader uses the default SystemManagers internally.

member.name: M:RenderingLibrary.Content.LoaderManager.Load(System.String,RenderingLibrary.SystemManagers)
member.summary: Loads a Texture2D from a file name. Supports .tga, png, jpg, and .gif.
member.param: The name of the file (full file name) to load from.
The SystemManagers to pull the GraphicsDevice for. A valid GraphicsDevice is needed to load Texture2D's. If "null" is passed, then the singleton Renderer will be used.

member.name: M:RenderingLibrary.Content.LoaderManager.LoadTextureFromFile(System.String,RenderingLibrary.SystemManagers)
member.summary: Performs a no-caching load of the texture. This will always go to disk to access a file and will always return a unique Texture2D. This should not be used in most cases, as caching is preferred
member.param: The filename to load
The optional SystemManagers to use when loading the file to obtain a GraphicsDevice
member.returns: The loaded Texture2D

member.name: F:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.AnimationFrame.SourceRectangle
member.summary: The source rectangle to display. If this is null then the entire source file is used.

member.name: F:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.AnimationFrame.FrameTime
member.summary: The amount of time to show the frame for in seconds.

member.name: M:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.BitmapFont.RenderToTexture2D(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},RenderingLibrary.Graphics.HorizontalAlignment,RenderingLibrary.SystemManagers,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D,System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.param: The maximum number of characters to render.

member.summary: Used for rendering directly to screen with an atlased texture.

member.name: M:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.ImageData.RemoveRow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the index row from the contained data. Row 0 is the top of the texture.
member.param: The index of the row to remove. Index 0 is the top row.

member.name: M:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.IRenderable.PreRender
member.summary: Perform logic which needs to occur before a SpriteBatch has been started

member.name: P:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.Layer.LayerCameraSettings
member.summary: Contains values which the Layer can use to override the camera settings. By default this is null, which means the Layer uses the camera settings.

member.name: M:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.Layer.SortRenderables
member.summary: This is a stable sort on Z. It's incredibly fast on already-sorted lists so we'll do this over something like the built-in binary sorts that .NET offers.

member.name: P:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.LayerCameraSettings.IsInScreenSpace
member.summary: Whether the current layer is in Screen Space. If true, then the Camera position does not impact the position of objects on this layer.

member.name: M:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.NineSlice.LoadAtlasedTexture(System.String,RenderingLibrary.Graphics.AtlasedTexture)
member.summary: Loads given texture(s) from atlas.

member.name: M:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.NineSlice.SetTexturesUsingPattern(System.String,RenderingLibrary.SystemManagers,System.Boolean)
member.param: True if textures are atlased.

member.name: F:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.Renderer.RenderUsingHierarchy
member.summary: Whether renderable objects should call Render on contained children. This is true by default, results in a hierarchical rendering order.

member.name: F:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.Renderer.SinglePixelSourceRectangle
member.summary: The rectangle to use when rendering single-pixel texture objects, such as ColoredRectangles. By default this is null, indicating the entire texture is used.

member.name: P:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.Renderer.NormalBlendState
member.summary: Controls which XNA BlendState is used for the Rendering Library's Blend.Normal value.
member.remarks: This should be either NonPremultiplied (if textures do not use premultiplied alpha), or AlphaBlend if using premultiplied alpha textures.

member.name: M:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.Renderer.ForceEnd
member.summary: Ends the current SpriteBatchif it hasn't yet been ended. This is needed for projects which may need the rendering to end itself so that they can start sprite batch.

member.name: F:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.Text.mPreRenderWidth
member.summary: Stores the width of the text object's texture before it has had a chance to render, not including the FontScale.
member.remarks: A text object may need to be positioned according to its dimensions. Normally this would use a text's render target texture. In some situations (before the render pass has occurred, or when using character-by-character rendering), the text may not have a render target texture. Therefore, the pre-rendered values provide size information.

member.name: F:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.Text.mPreRenderHeight
member.summary: Stores the height of the text object's texture before it has had a chance to render, not including the FontScale.
member.remarks: See mPreRenderWidth for more information about this member.

member.name: P:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.Text.WrappedTextWidth
member.summary: The width needed to display the wrapped text.

member.name: P:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.Text.MaxLettersToShow
member.summary: The maximum letters to display. This can be used to create an effect where the text prints out letter-by-letter.

member.name: M:RenderingLibrary.Graphics.SolidRectangle.GetAtlasedTexture
member.summary: Checks if the Colored Rectangle texture is located in a loaded atlas.
member.returns: Returns atlased texture if it exists.

member.name: M:RenderingLibrary.IPositionedSizedObjectExtensionMethods.GetAbsoluteX(RenderingLibrary.Graphics.IRenderableIpso)
member.summary: Returns the top-left world X coordinate of the argument RenderableIpso.
member.param: The RenderableIpso to return the value for.
member.returns: The world X coordinate.

member.name: M:RenderingLibrary.IPositionedSizedObjectExtensionMethods.GetAbsoluteY(RenderingLibrary.Graphics.IRenderableIpso)
member.summary: Returns the world Y coordinate of the argument RenderableIpso.
member.param: The RenderableIpso to return the value for.
member.returns: The world Y coordinate.

member.name: P:RenderingLibrary.SystemManagers.GlobalFontScale
member.summary: The font scale value. This can be used to scale all fonts globally, generally in response to a font scaling value like the Android font scale setting.

member.name: T:ToolsUtilities.FileManager
member.summary: Utility class used to help dealing with files.
member.remarks: This code is a copy of code from FlatRedBall. It's ok, Victor Chelaru wrote that code and he's the one who put it in here.

member.name: M:ToolsUtilities.FileManager.GetExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the extension in a filename.
member.param: The filename.
member.returns: Returns the extension or an empty string if no period is found in the filename.

member.name: M:ToolsUtilities.FileManager.RemoveExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the fileName without an extension, or makes no changes if fileName has no extension.
member.param: The file name.
member.returns: The file name with extension removed if an extension existed.

member.name: M:ToolsUtilities.FileManager.RemovePath(System.String@)
member.summary: Modifies the fileName by removing its path, or makes no changes if the fileName has no path.
member.param: The file name to change

member.name: M:ToolsUtilities.FileManager.RemovePath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the fileName without a path, or makes no changes if the fileName has no path.
member.param: The file name.
member.returns: The modified fileName if a path is found.

member.name: M:ToolsUtilities.FileManager.GetAllFilesInDirectory(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a List containing all files which match the fileType argument which are in the directory argument or a subfolder. This recurs, returning all files.
member.param: String representing the directory to search. If an empty string is passed, the method will search starting in the directory holding the .exe.

The file type to search for specified as an extension. The extension can either have a period or not. That is ".jpg" and "jpg" are both valid fileType arguments. An empty or null value for this parameter will return all files regardless of file type.
member.returns: A list containing all of the files found which match the fileType.

member.name: M:ToolsUtilities.FileManager.GetAllFilesInDirectory(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a List containing all files which match the fileType argument which are within the depthToSearch folder range relative to the directory argument.
member.param: String representing the directory to search. If an empty string is passed, the method will search starting in the directory holding the .exe.

The file type to search for specified as an extension. The extension can either have a period or not. That is ".jpg" and "jpg" are both valid fileType arguments. An empty or null value for this parameter will return all files regardless of file type.
The depth to search through. If the depthToSearch is 0, only the argument directory will be searched.
member.returns: A list containing all of the files found which match the fileType.

member.name: P:ToolsUtilities.FileManager.UserApplicationDataForThisApplication
member.summary: Returns a full path for a folder which can be used to save user data.

member.name: M:ToolsUtilities.StringFunctions.GetIntAfter(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the first integer found after the argument stringToSearchFor in whereToSearch.
member.remarks: This method is used to help simplify parsing of text files and data strings. If stringToSearchFor is "Y:" and whereToSearch is "X: 30, Y:32", then the value of 32 will be returned.
member.param: The string pattern to search for.
The string that will be searched.
member.returns: The integer value found after the argument stringToSearchFor.

member.name: M:ToolsUtilities.StringFunctions.GetIntAfter(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the first integer found after the argument stringToSearchFor. The search begins at the argument startIndex.
member.param: The string pattern to search for.
The string that will be searched.
The index to begin searching at. This method will ignore any instances of stringToSearchFor which begin at an index smaller than the argument startIndex.

member.name: M:ToolsUtilities.StringFunctions.IncrementNumberAtEnd(System.String)
member.summary: Increments the number at the end of a string or adds a number if none exists.
member.remarks: This method begins looking at the end of a string for numbers and moves towards the beginning of the string until it encounters a character which is not a numerical digit or the beginning of the string. "Sprite123" would return "Sprite124", and "MyString" would return "MyString1".
member.param: The string to "increment".
member.returns: Returns a string with the number at the end incremented, or with a number added on the end if none existed before.

member.name: M:ToolsUtilities.StringFunctions.InsertSpacesInCamelCaseString(System.String)
member.summary: Inserts spaces before every capital letter in a camel-case string. Ignores the first letter.
member.remarks: For example "HelloThereIAmCamelCase" becomes "Hello There I Am Camel Case".
member.param: The string in which to insert spaces.
member.returns: The string with spaces inserted.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Gum.Animation.GumAnimation.AnimationSpeed
member.summary: The speed multiplier used to play the animation. A value greater than 1 will make the animation play faster than normal. For example, a value of 2 will make the animation play two times as fast. This must be greater than 0

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Gum.Animation.GumAnimation.namedEvents
member.summary: List of named events, used when the animation is played.
member.remarks: This is not a Dictionary becuase we want to allow the same event name to appear multiple times. For example, a user might create a "Bounce" event where a sound effect plays. An animation may bounce multiple times, so the same event might be added in multiple spots.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Gum.GumIdb.DisableDrawing
member.summary: Makes the Gum IDB skip its rendering code. This can be used to isolate rendering performance bottlenecks.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Gum.GumIdb.mLastDrawCall
member.summary: Variable that stores the last draw call. It is used to determine if drawing a new frame.

member.name: T:GumCoreShared.FlatRedBall.Embedded.PositionedObjectGueWrapper
member.summary: A PositionedObject which can hold a reference to a Gum object (GraphicalUiElement) to position it in FlatRedBall coordinates. This allows Gum objects to be positioned in world space, and if the FrbObject is attached to another FlatRedBall object, then the Gum object can move with the parent FlatRedBall object, enabling attachments.

member.name: P:GumCoreShared.FlatRedBall.Embedded.PositionedObjectGueWrapper.FrbObject
member.summary: The FlatRedBall object controlling the position of the Gum object. This is typically an entity instance, and codegen in the FRB Editor assigns this automatically when adding a Gum object to a FlatRedBall entity.

member.name: M:GumCoreShared.FlatRedBall.Embedded.PositionedObjectGueWrapper.GetAbsolutePositionInFrbSpace(Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement)
member.summary: Returns the absolute world position of the center of the argument graphicalUiElement.
member.remarks: This can be used to position FRB objects (such as collision shapes) according to the absolute position of the Glue object.
member.param: The argument GraphicalUiElement.
member.returns: The absolute position of the center of the GraphicalUiElement
